title.narrative: Mechanism 16585 - Capacity Building in HIV Co-infection Activities to Address the Continuum of Prevention, Care and Treatment in Central America, CoAg # GH001100

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
URC’s main goal is to assist countries in strengthening TB and fungal HIV co-infection surveillance activities, and in improving access of HIV+ KPs to integrated HIV clinical services in CAR.
During FY 2015-2016 in Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama, URC will provide TA to national and provincial TB and HIV program staff to 1) intensify TB case finding among PLHIV at targeted high burden Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. objectives

URC’s main goal is to assist countries in strengthening TB and fungal HIV co-infection surveillance activities, and in improving access of HIV+ KPs to integrated HIV clinical services in CAR.
During FY 2015-2016 in Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama, URC will provide TA to national and provincial TB and HIV program staff to 1) intensify TB case finding among PLHIV at targeted high burden TB/HIV districts, 2) improve access to HIV testing among TB patients, 3) ensure linkages to HIV and TB care and treatment across TB and HIV clinics, and 4) strengthen TB/HIV data collection, analysis, use, and dissemination. URC will also improve the reach and delivery of sustainable TB/HIV services by strengthening laboratory diagnostics and providing TA in TB/HIV testing and counseling techniques, including stigma and discrimination towards KPs.
In Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, and Panama, URC will 1) provide trainings on rapid and precise methods to improve diagnosis of fungal infections among PLHIV, and 2) develop a web based registry of fungal OIs within official MOH databases in each country.
In addition, URC will 1) support TB infection control measures to prevent transmission of TB in HIV clinics by conducting TB infection control assessments and implementing recommendations in the region, and 2) organize a regional TOT covering various TB topics.
Institutional capacity will be strengthened and accurate and timely data will be available to design interventions to improve services to PLHIV who have TB and/or fungal OIs in CAR. Activities will be harmonized with strategies from GFATM, PAHO, and TBCoE to avoid duplicity of efforts. All activities will be monitored monthly by URC using specific process and output indicators to be identified at a later time.

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
